thread.title: Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5
thread.title_full: Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5

author: JON KRAWCZYNSKI
title: Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5
text:
Jim Mone Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Indiana Fever's Tamika Catchings takes questions from the media, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in Minneapolis as the team prepares for the decisive Game 5 of the WNBA basketball finals against the Minnesota Lynx. (AP Photo/Jim Mone) Michael Conroy Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Minnesota Lynx's Maya Moore, right, looks to the basket as Indiana Fever's Tamika Catchings defends in the second half of Game 4 of the WNBA Finals basketball series, in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Michael Conroy) Michael Conroy Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Minnesota Lynx's Renee Montgomery holds out her arms in the first half of Game 4 of the WNBA Finals basketball series, in Indianapolis against the Indiana Fever, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Michael Conroy) Michael Conroy Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Indiana Fever's Briann January, center, heads to the basket as Minnesota Lynx's Seimone Augustus, left, and Anna Cruz, right, watch in the first half of Game 4 of the WNBA Finals basketball series, in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Michael Conroy) Michael Conroy Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Indiana Fever head coach Stephanie White watches from the sidelines in the first half of Game 4 of the WNBA Finals basketball series, in Indianapolis against the Minnesota Lynx, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Michael Conroy) Michael Conroy Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 
Minnesota Lynx head coach Cheryl Reeve is seen on the sidelines in the first half of Game 4 of the WNBA Finals basketball series against the Indiana Fever, in Indianapolis, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Michael Conroy) Posted: Tuesday, October 13, 2015 5:33 pm Lynx, Fever ready for WNBA Finals-deciding Game 5 Associated Press | 0 comments 
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) â€” Before the Indiana Fever embarked on their 11th consecutive trip to the WNBA playoffs, veteran star Tamika Catchings handed out a journal to every one of her teammates. 
The message was simple: For as routine as these trips have come for the Fever, it was so important to soak up the opportunities because you never know when they will present themselves again.
